scenes.description: EXT. CITY PARK - AUTUMN AFTERNOON. Golden leaves swirl as LENA (28, reserved artist) drops her sketchbook. ETHAN (30, warm-hearted writer) catches it mid-air. Their hands brush.
scenes.dialogue: "Your art... it feels like it’s been waiting to be seen," he says, glancing at her sketches. "Not many notice the details," she replies, blushing.

scenes.description: INT. COZY BOOKSTORE - EVENING. They sit by a fireplace, sharing a worn poetry anthology. Lena traces a line on a page; Ethan watches her, smitten.
scenes.dialogue: "This verse—it’s like it’s ours," she murmurs. "Maybe we’re just catching up to it," he grins, leaning closer.

scenes.description: EXT. RAIN-SOAKED STREET - NIGHT. They argue under a flickering lamp. Lena turns to leave; Ethan grabs her hand, his jacket soaked.
scenes.dialogue: "You can’t vanish every time it gets real!" he pleads. "What if ‘real’ breaks us?" she whispers, tears mixing with rain.

scenes.description: INT. ETHAN’S APARTMENT - DAWN. Sunlight filters through curtains. Lena paints at an easel; Ethan wakes, awestruck by the portrait of them dancing.
scenes.dialogue: "You painted us... together?" "I painted us as I hope we’ll be," she says softly. He pulls her into a silent embrace.

scenes.description: EXT. TRAIN STATION - WINTER MORNING. Ethan sprints through the crowd, clutching a letter. Lena stands by a departing train, conflicted. He shouts her name.
scenes.dialogue: "Stay—let’s rewrite the ending!" he gasps. She drops her ticket, running into his arms. "Write it with me," she breathes.
